decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total to increase the power of Death's Shadow while disrupting your opponent's hand with Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. Gurmag Angler provides a big threat that can come down quickly, and Snapcaster Mage allows you to reuse key spells from your graveyard. Cling to Dust provides additional disruption and life gain, while Stubborn Denial helps protect your threats. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to deal with opposing threats. Thought Scour and Mishra's Bauble help dig through your deck and enable delve for Angler and synergy with Snapcaster Mage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces, such as Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Thassa's Oracle, to win the game in one explosive turn. By utilizing cards like Serum Visions, Spoils of the Vault, and Pentad Prism to draw cards and generate mana, the deck aims to cast Ad Nauseam to draw its entire deck and play Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck also includes protection in the form of Pact of Negation and Phyrexian Unlife to help ensure the combo is successful.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently use Ad Nauseam to draw through the entire library, then win the game by playing Thassa's Oracle to win on the spot. The deck includes a mix of control elements like Pact of Negation and Angels Grace to protect the combo, as well as ramp with cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to help get the necessary mana to go off. The deck aims to set up and execute the combo as quickly and consistently as possible while disrupting opponent's game plan.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage provided by powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining incremental advantages with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Mystic Sanctuary. By efficiently managing resources and responding to threats, the deck can gradually take control of the game and secure victory through attrition.

This Gruul Utopia deck focuses on ramping up quickly with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf to play powerful threats like Elder Gargaroth and Klothys, God of Destiny. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Magus of the Moon, Pillage, and Blood Moon to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of strong creatures, removal spells like Lightning Bolt, and land destruction, this deck aims to take control of the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while keeping them on the back foot.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the board and dictate the pace of the game. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck aims to generate value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Growth Spiral, while also having options to disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Force of Negation and Aether Gust.

The deck revolves around utilizing Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle in combination with multiple land fetching and ramping abilities to trigger its ability multiple times in a turn, dealing significant damage to the opponent. The deck includes a variety of creatures that help with ramping, searching for key pieces, or disrupting the opponent's strategy. With the ability to quickly ramp up and set up powerful combos, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of land-based triggers from Valakut and its supporting cards.

This deck focuses on utilizing graveyard interaction to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with cards like Gravecrawler, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By constantly dredging and milling cards with cards like Hedron Crab and Stitcher's Supplier, the deck aims to trigger powerful combos that bring back creatures like Vengevine and create explosive plays. Cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional value by ramping and gaining life. Creeping Chill and Glimpse the Unthinkable help to further fill the graveyard and provide additional damage to opponents. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a quick and relentless assault.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively apply pressure on the opponent using low-cost and efficient creatures like Abbot of Keral Keep, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Cling to Dust to control the opponent's strategy. The deck utilizes a combination of burn spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt to finish off the opponent quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recurring key cards from the graveyard for added value and consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate explosively fast mana ramp with cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Primeval Titan. This allows the player to quickly tutor and summon powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and create overwhelming board presence. The inclusion of lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Field of the Dead adds additional win conditions, making it a versatile and powerful combo deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. The deck uses cards like Phyrexian Unlife and Pentad Prism to buy time and generate mana, while also utilizing cantrips like Serum Visions to dig for combo pieces. Spoils of the Vault is used to search for specific combo pieces quickly. The deck also includes Pact of Negation to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's plans. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win before the opponent can disrupt the plan.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a board of small, aggressive creatures such as Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, Sprite Dragon, and Stormwing Entity. The deck contains a number of cheap, efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Wild Slash to clear the way for these creatures to attack. The use of cards like Opt, Light Up the Stage, and Bedlam Reveler helps to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of low-cost spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on using mana acceleration and disruption to quickly deploy powerful threats that can outpace and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf to generate extra mana, combined with disruptive spells like Blood Moon and Pillage, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with creatures like Seasoned Pyromancer, Elder Gargaroth, and Bloodbraid Elf. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Lightning Bolt and Bonecrusher Giant to deal with threats and maintain board control.

This Aggro Jund deck focuses on utilizing a combination of efficient removal spells and hand disruption to control the board while deploying powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf. The deck aims to pressure opponents quickly and efficiently, while also generating card advantage through cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Wrenn and Six. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and presenting a diverse array of threats, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and come out on top in fast-paced, interactive games.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana with mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Heritage Druid, then use cards like Collected Company to dump a bunch of elves onto the battlefield to overwhelm your opponent. Leyline of Abundance helps with mana acceleration as well. The deck aims to finish off the opponent with Shaman of the Pack's ETB effect or by pumping up your elves with Ezuri, Renegade Leader for a lethal attack. The key strategy is to swarm the board with elves and use their synergy to create a powerful combo.

The focus of this deck is to quickly mill the opponent's library, primarily using Hedron Crab, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, and Glimpse the Unthinkable. It seeks to disrupt the opponent's strategy with Archive Trap, surgical extraction, and Drown in the Loch, while maintaining card advantage with Visions of Beyond. The combo potential is enhanced with Mesmeric Orb, while also providing control elements with Fatal Push and Cling to Dust. The mana base is designed to support the dual-colored requirements of the deck, with additional utility lands like Field of Ruin and Shelldock Isle.

The deck focuses on quickly building an army of Merfolk creatures and using their Lord abilities to pump them up and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Harbinger of the Tides and Merfolk Trickster to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also using Spreading Seas to disrupt their mana base, the deck aims to maintain momentum and push for a quick victory. The Aether Vial helps to accelerate the deployment of creatures, while Dismember offers removal options when needed. The deck's efficient curve and synergy between its cards make it a powerful Aggro option in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that enable graveyard synergies to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures and then bring them back to the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It utilizes cards like Bloodghast, Prized Amalgam, and Silversmote Ghoul to consistently bring back creatures from the graveyard, while using cards like Life from the Loam and Cathartic Reunion to fill up the graveyard and fuel the recursion engine. The goal is to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent with a steady stream of creatures.

The deck focuses on using Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and allow for explosive plays with Primeval Titan. It aims to ramp quickly and efficiently through lands like Simic Growth Chamber and bounce lands, while also utilizing cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Sakura-Tribe Scout to put multiple lands into play in a single turn. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces to tutor up Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Field of the Dead, generating a win condition through a combination of landfall triggers and direct damage.

The deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo, utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and lands like Simic Growth Chamber and Gruul Turf to efficiently ramp up and generate insane amounts of value. Karn, the Great Creator is included to provide additional utility and disruption. The deck aims to quickly ramp up and tutor for key pieces to overwhelm the opponent and establish a dominant board presence. The key concept revolves around fast ramping, land synergies, and powerful combo potential to outpace and outvalue the opponent.
